intro: Rhynchospora joveroensis var. breviseta, commonly known as the short-haired marsh sedge, is a flowering plant native to specific wetland habitats in South America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The species is characterized by its compact growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its inflorescence consists of a dense cluster of small, three-stamened flowers. This variant is distinguished by its shorter, more densely packed bracts compared to other varieties within the species.
